message.content:
cs.CR, cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.AI, cs.SI

The paper discusses a security threat related to Brain-Computer-Interface (BCI) devices, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The attack involves analyzing subliminal brain activity, which is related to human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the feasibility of the attack through experimental studies, which involves data analysis and machine learning (cs.CY, cs.AI). Finally, the paper proposes a new type of attack that can be scaled to many victims, which is related to social and information networks (cs.SI).
